page.title: 01A NW Section of Isle of Coll
page.content: This block covers some of the North West coast line and interior of the Isle of Coll block consists of coastal dune, enclosed rough grassland, moor, wetland and a small area of cultivated land. Six houses in block, four occupied. Land covers two farms extensive farming practised, comprising of three enterprises. 1: pure blackface sheep on rough grassland, moor, wetland & coastal dunes. 2: blackface cheviot cross ewes put to a Suffolk tup to give grossbred lambs, on enclosed grassland. 3: cattle on coastal dunes and rough grassland cultivations produce silage & hay for winter feed for cattle and rape for fattening lambs. The only other feature of importance is the number of rare birds and plants to be found in this region.
